medical_history.chief_complaint: Nasal scotoma in the left eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began one month after starting dalteparin following delivery. Initially, she reported a nasal scotoma in her left eye, with subsequent worsening visual symptoms characterized by increased paracentral scotomata and occasional blurriness in the left eye after discharge while on warfarin. Visual acuity remained stable, but retinal findings showed increased venous tortuosity and dot hemorrhages over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a positive family history of hypercoagulation; her mother experienced a postpartum pulmonary embolism and her sister has protein C deficiency. The patient was evaluated for a hypercoagulable state, revealing mild protein C (66%) and protein S (56%) deficiencies.
medical_history.family_history: Her mother had a postpartum pulmonary embolism and her sister was diagnosed with protein C deficiency.
